intro: Dichaetanthera sambiranensis, commonly known as the Sambiranensis dichaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive floral structure, featuring showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
